wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Thanks for writing this up... Didn't know about the new hook,. I am planning on writing a new module, which will definetly use this hook. We should realy work on the documentation in drupal.org about CCK hooks... it's getting realy outdated :X
אני כרגע בונה אתר חנות בדרופל בפעם הראשונה http://cmsisrael.com אני שוקל להצטרף לקורס ויש לי מספר שאלות אנא צרו איתי קשר 054-4404053

יש לי שאלה: אפשר יהיה בקורס לעבוד על אתר שאני בונה עכשיו - זה אתר עם אוברקרט ורשת חברתית (אני עושה עם קבוצות אורגניות, אלא אם כן יש למישהו המלצה למשהו אחר). יש לי הרבה שאלות ספציפיות על דברים שאני לא מצליח.
יותם

שלום יותם,
צורת העבודה בקורס היא באמצעות עבודה מעשית. בעיקרון אנחנו לוקחים משימות ועובדים עליהם. אנחנו לא נתעסק רק באיזה כפתור צריך ללחוץ, אלא בתפיסה יותר כוללנית, של בכלל איך פותרים בעיה. אם תרצה תוכל להספיק לעבוד על האתר שלך גם בזמן הקורס, וגם במסגרת השיעורי בית שניתן לכם.
לגבי הרשת החברתית, אני לא יודע בדיוק מה הצרכים שלך, אבל עבודה עם קבוצות אורגניות (organic groups), נשמע הכיוון הנכון. מאחר ואני כותב את הגירסא הבא של המודול, אני חושב שאוכל לענות לך על השאלות :)
עניין בקשר לקורס [EDIT: Remove number] מספר שאלות
כבר שלחתי הודעה דרך ה'צור קשר' ולא נעניתי אז אני נאלצת לפנות בפומבי. אני מעוניינת לקבל פרטים על הקורס. (נתתי את המייל שלי בכתיבת הודעה זו אז ניתן להשיב לשם, אני מעדיפה שלא לפרסם את המייל שלי כאן)

כמעט 4000 ש"ח, עלות של חצי שנת שכר לימוד באוניברסיטה לצורך העניין, עבור 6 מפגשים? 6 מפגשים? במחיר של 160 ש"ח לשעה אפשר גם לקחת מורה פרטי אחד על אחד ולא לשבת בכיתה. המחיר מוגזם , מופקע ומופרע לחלוטין. ועוד אתם לא מספקים אפילו כיתת לימוד כמקובל, אלא צריך גם להביא מחשב נייד. המחיר צריך להיות לא יותר מאשר חצי מאשר המחיר הזה.
חבל.

ראשית, זכותך לבחור במה להשקיע את הכסף שלך. שנית, לעומת האוניברסיטה, היחס תלמידים מורים הוא 1:3. שלישית, וזה לדעתי החשוב ביותר -- אין (ולמיטב ידיעתי לא היה) קורס כזה בארץ, שמספק מידע ברמה כזאת. אתה מוזמן לפנות למשתתפים בקורס ולשאול לדעתם.
מה דרוש כידע בסיסי להצטרף לקורס?

המינימום ההכרחי הוא הכרת דרופל ואת המודולים CCK ו- VIEWS. אם למישהו חסר ידע אנחנו "שולחים" אותו להכין שיעורי בית ולהכיר גם את FLAG ו- RULES.
פנה\י אלינו בטלפון, ונוכל לראות אם הקורס מתאים לך.
דרופל היא מערכת ניהול התוכן החביבה על מקצוענים תודה על המאמר מאיר העיניים מריחואנה רפואית אינסטלטור בתל אביב
דרופל מהווה היום כ 1% מהאתרים ברשת מצלמות אבטחה
אז למה לנו כל העניין הזה?

item.title: Does every page really need to be a node?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
I would like to have panels pages for my department homepages that aggregates all of that departments content, but from what I understand panels pages aren't searchable.
Is this true? How do you work around this? For instance, say I have "Human Resources" department homepage as a panel page. If a users searches for "Human Resources" will the Human Resources panel page show up in the results? I know panel nodes do, but they are much more limited.
What's your thoughts about the best approach to this situation?

@gmclelland, Indeed this is a problem. But in your case I think it makes sense to add the HR as nodes. Panels can have the Views that shows those nodes. Panels itself IMO should only "group" the elements you want to show together.

And the most important part of that guideline is that it is nationality neutral. It doesn't matter if the company you're talking to is in Mumbai, Madrid, Montreal, or Montgomery. The same "do they have a clue" litmus test still applies. If they use arg(), don't hire 'em. :-)

You have obviously not managed a single project outsourced to New-Delhi. No individual or organisation from India will ever reply WTF (either literally or figuratively). They will read your mail, they will google your Drupal buzz words and they will give you the exact answers you're looking for. Throwing a pile of insider hype lingo at them is not a litmus test by a long shot, even if you call it a community.
The only way to successfully manage an outsourced/offshored development project is to invest heavily in management, which practically boils down to going there yourself and bothering to learn to understand their accent.
I actually lived in New-Delhi for 1.5 years. Hack, I even knew how to read and write Hindi. Anyway, I wouldn't take *every* sentence in this post literally... :)

אני גם חושב שבכל מצב שלא יהיה אתה חייב להעביר גם את בסיס הנתונים לשרת החי אז מה זה משנה?
אני מבין שזה רק ניסיון ליצור אידיאה ולא משהו מעשי לביצוע מיידי...

זה לא אידאה זה לגמריי אפשרי אבל זה יותר קשה ויש לזה תקורות בפיתוח. המקום שאתה (מי שלא תהיה) מפספס הוא שזה מתאים לאתר שכבר "יצא לפרודקשן" ומתפקד כלפיי חוץ. באתר כזה אתה בהכרח לא דורס יותר את בסיס הנתונים משרתי הפיתוח אל שרת הייצור. האתגרים הם איך עושים זאת תוך עבודת צוות ואיך שולטים על האיזון בין תקורות הפיתוח של הפתרונות והתיקונים לעומת פיתוח הdeployment עצמה. בכל מקרה אין ספק שאמיתי מיומן להעביר את העקרונות האלה ומי שיוכל בכלל להכיל אותם ישדרג את יכולות הדרופל שלו.
כמו כן, גם אם נכון שצריך להעביר קנפוגים מסוימים ממסד הפיתוח למסד הייצור (ועדיף דרך סביבת מבחן) עדיין עדיף כמה שפחות, והעברה לקוד מורידה את רמת הסיכון בקנפוג שגוי.

> ... ויש לזה תקורות בפיתוח.
מסכים לגמרי. בסופו של יום יש את שיקול העלות מול תועלת. אך כמובן השאלה הנשאלת היא האם לא מעבירים דברים לקוד מבחירה או מחוסר ידע? אפילו אם מעבירים רק 80% לקוד והשאר ידני, מרוויחים.
> ...לא דורס יותר את בסיס הנתונים...
זה באמת הקושי הגדול, ואין פתרון קסם אחד. יש מספר פתרונות וצריך לדעת להתאים אותן.
> ומי שיוכל בכלל להכיל אותם ישדרג את יכולות הדרופל שלו.
תודה. מאוד אשמח אם גם תוכל להגיע - כבר אמרתי לך שמה שאתה שכחת בלינוקס אני עוד לא למדתי :)

> אני גם חושב שבכל מצב שלא יהיה אתה חייב להעביר גם את בסיס הנתונים
צורת עבודה כזאת היא טעות, ואני שולל אותה מכל וכל.
> אני מבין שזה רק ניסיון ליצור אידיאה ולא משהו מעשי לביצוע מיידי...
ממש לא נכון. בוא ביום רביעי ותראה שזאת כלל לא אידיאה.
סינכרון אתר דב/סטייג'ינג/לייב היא בעיה שנתקלים בה כל הזמן אצלינו. זה בחינם?
בסדר בסדר. אני מגיע.
חינם לגמרי. אחד הדברים שנדבר עליו הוא שינוי בתפיסה והורדת הסטייג'ינג מהמשוואה (לפעמים אי אפשר, אבל אני מדבר על הכלל).
מצויין - ואז נגלה מי אתה "אנונימוס" :)
אני מגיע.
היה מאלף, תודה רבה!
Thanks Amitai, it was really great

וכל הנושא של העברה לקוד הוא נכון מאוד.
תודה שהעליתם את זה בריס ואמִתּי!
אמיר
נ.ב. היה לי קשה לקבוע מרעשי הרקע האם אתם עובדים מעל מרפאת שיניים, מסגרייה או מוסך של אוטובוסים :-)

ההרצאה מצויינת - תודה שהקלטתם. אני גר בצפון הרחוק - וקשה לי להגיע למפגשים. יישר כח.
אמנון לבב לבבי ייעוץ משולב

I was little taken back with your wording here.
Before people start diving into the code, you should realize that OG has changed and its concept has been polished and can be summarized into one line: OG brings roles and permissions to the group level.
Specially the last line need more clarification. And I hoping the clarification is OG brings roles and permissions to the group level in a scalable way" Current drupal core roles and permissions are NOT scalable (atleast not UI). Those are fine for few (less than 20 roles and permissions) but does not scale for thousands of roles and permission and their combinations. OG (atleast 6x) scales to thousands of groups and giving each group member to subscribe and post with different combinations. I hope 7x OG (UI or backend) is NOT taking away this scalability and works with thousnads of groups as it does now.

@ajayg,
I encourage you to help test and review OG with thousands of groups, in order to fine tune performance.

By scalability I do not mean performance. I meant aba]ility to manage in UI those thousands of roles and permissions. I am not concerned abou whether the UI will come up in given time. I am concerned whether the UI will be able to allow admin user to administer those permissions? Try 20 roles in core drupal and try going to permissions page and you will see what I mean.
why would you need 20 roles to begin with?

By scalability I do not mean performance. I meant aba]ility to manage in UI those thousands of roles and permissions. I am not concerned abou whether the UI will come up in given time. I am concerned whether the UI will be able to allow admin user to administer those permissions? Try 20 roles in core drupal and try going to permissions page and you will see what I mean.
_________
starlas eymour from http://www.plaque-cuisson.net

I too already have flags and rules installed and I like the idea of using existing modules vs adding userpoints. However how does the performance compare if we were to create a lot of rules to handle userpoints vs the userpoints module?

Now the question that pops to my mind is what's the goal?
And i answer to myself (it's late and no one else is here) the goal is to create the system with minimal complexity. (which is relevant ofcourse to the people maintaining the system and their preferences)
Not to implement the given spec with minimal coding - because at a certain point you're just coding with drupal modules + rules + sets which is harder to debug & maintain.
The triggering is brilliant but i would rather have some simple code saying deduct a point - if 0 - take off the storyEditorRole
wouldn't it be more clear? maybe not? first comment @here ראשון שולתת

Flag is a powerful module - even without Rules. Your tutorial shows how much can be achieved by connecting these modules intelligently.
At www.GlobeDweller.com we use Flag to connect user with content so choosing a particular country will show the users that have flagged it (i.e. chosen it as a country they have been to), that way people not finding the help they need from the content itself will have a list of people with actual experience of the country. On the other hand if people go to the user profiles they can see where people have been.
Thanks for the tutorial. This seems like an excellent solution for restricting paid accounts to making a single entry in, for instance, a business directory.

@hed, > you're just coding with drupal modules + rules + sets
I agree, as I later export it to code, just as I do with Views, I consider it coding.
> ...which is harder to debug & maintain.
Debug isn't necessarily harder thanks to Rules debug -- which I find sometimes faster than starting to xDebug code. About maintaining I disagree. When you are used to working with Rules you can also do the changes directly via the code export. Also to maintain it I don't need to hire a developer, as no coding is involved.
> but i would rather have some simple code saying
Same argument for why using Views even if it would be faster for you to write a simple SQL query.
Yap, it also works great in complex e-commerce sites.

"Also to maintain it I don't need to hire a developer, as no coding is involved." this i feel to some extent is self disillusioning.
Coding is not just the language, but is also complexity, debugging and mental state.
If giving a client a complex site in which there is a lot of business logic made up from Rules. The client will not only be needed to hire a developer, a drupal developer but as well one who is acquainted with the module. And i bet that even for this developer it would have been easier if it was debuggable code.
Complexity is physical entity. Nothing can become simpler than it really is. חוק שימור הסבוכיות
Rules debugging is GOOD. Any decent rules engine has to have a debugger.
Need to really touch it to know better Maybe at your course!

> this i feel to some extent is self disillusioning.
You say "self disillusioning" like it's a bad thing! ;) But seriously, I used Views way before I knew how to write SQL queries. Views can also become complex and need some knowledge.
With that said, my goal in this tutorial wasn't to talk only about the "user points" use case, but more about showing it's true power. Now it's up to you to decide if you join the ride -- yeah, come to my course (Tel-Aviv) and we can argue some more :P
the link to nick lewis is relative, make it absolute!
10x, fixed.

Nice article on using and working with 960 grids in Drupal! If you haven't already, you might want to check out the Skinr module which let's you make those 960 grid classes available in the Drupal UI for certain elements (blocks, content types, views, panels, node, etc.) so you can set widths right from the admin. The most updated Zen theme also now includes Skinr support. You can check out the Fusion themes from TNT for nice examples of including 960 support.
Dear Amitaibu, thanks for this useful article, please remove gizra_ninesixty\layouts\basic\basic.css this file maybe make confuse people.

> please remove gizra_ninesixty\layouts\basic\basic.css
Right you are - removed. Also note that porting of zen_960 is in progress -- http://drupal.org/node/768602

Hello,
Your theme is very useful, but when I create a book, there is no link to add a child page or to view the printer-friendly version.
Can you please add this??
Thanks!
Please disregard the preceding comment. I figured it out.

Good post!!!
What will I do if for Example the right sidebar is 243px and it is 12px from the right side? Can I still use the 960? Sure it's just an Example...

> right sidebar is 243px and it is 12px from the right side?
You can override 960's CSS, as you would to any other CSS. set your sidebar to be width: 243px;
I wasn't looking for an answer similar to your question but for everyone who is and read your "I figured it out" comment: You're an ass for not posting the answer with this post.

*ahem* I didn't post the answer because I had hidden that bit in my CSS with display:none. I don't think this solution would help anyone else unless they had done the same thing.
In other words, the 'Add a Child Page' link does exist; no modification to the theme is necessary.
Hope that clears things up!
So I figure, but how is it effect the benefit of the 960 grid sys?
http://drupal.org/project/panels_960gs

Nice tutor...
The one big problem I have with ninesixty, which shouldn't be ignored. The spacing between the verticals is to large.
Go to the news sites like CNN, FOX, and other busy content rich sites. Those sites pack the data onto their sites and the spacing is minsicule between content items. It's not difficult to read and follow either.
I love the concept, but not the completed product even with 16 verticals the spacing between is too large. I want the ability to pack the content, whether I use it all or not.
Just a site note, one of my non-site builder friends said, "that website looks like a primary school book pages".
You tutor was a good read.
Thank you
Cheers for creating this it was note for a paper I am at this time writing for my thesis. Thanks hermes kellyhermes kelly bags

item.title: סרט בנושא 'לוגיקות מורכבות ללא קידוד (או מאוד מאוד מעט)'

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I’ll make certain to remember this web site and take a visit consistently.Glad I found this site lots of information ... birkin handbags hermes kelly

Base templates for a UI sound good to start with. Keep in mind that specific tasks and context may require to deviate from the template in order to provide the optimal ui.
Would be nice to actually see what you did here :)
delete. site

Naturally, if you want to add a form/ webform you can do it via the Panels page.But to make it dynamic you can add the "Page ID"/ "Location" to your webform content type, and change the View's filter to include webform as-well.
What is the page id refer to ? the node id or path alias of another content to display ?

@Adrian,
The page ID is any text you want to use. It can be a for example a campaign you are running (e.g. "april-2010-deal" and another would be "march-2010-deal-for-us-only".

This is a great tip. This is much better than the way I was doing landing pages. I doing lots of different types of marketing and this is great for quick and easy landing pages (for adwords for example). One tweak I made was to allow the content to have multiple pageid's. That way you can reuse your content for multiple landing pages (like an image or lead capturing form). Also, I would add use pathauto to make the path of the "landing page element" something like "mysite.com/lp-element/elementnode" and add /lp-element/ to my directories section of my robots.txt. That way your landing pages aren't seen as duplicate content of your element nodes by the search engines. Also, instead of doing the theme stuff, couldn't you just change your view up so it only shows the node body... not the full node? That would also get rid of the "display post information" stuff. Great stuff I like this idea.

This really got me thinking about how this could be used for image banners.
A great solution to this problem is to use http://drupal.org/project/headerimage
But, I was hoping to replace this module with views and the technique you mentioned.
Headerimage allows you to create dynamic blocks that you can assign nodes to.
Headerimage allows you to specify the visibility settings for each node and choose which block the node is assigned to.
This article allows you to do something similar like specify the paths(page-ids) that the node should appear on but doesn't quite cover the cases like show on /2007/*
Oh well, back to the drawing board. Thanks for the article.

> Also, instead of doing the theme stuff, couldn't you just change your view up so it only shows the node
A node can have other fields attached to it, and sometimes your want your Views to be ignorant about the fields. Anyway, you are right, there are some tweaks you can have -- the post here tried to keep things simple.
Also, if you keep a single page ID, you can later have a rule that will redirect users to the landing page, if they try to view a "landing page element" node.
I'm happy you liked it :)

Hed pointed out that Realm is pronounced Relm http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/realm
And I say, Man if you don't want me to pronounce the A, then don't write it! ;)
This module looks nice and clean, and I may use it on a large-ish site I work on.

> and I may use it on a large-ish site I work on.
Cool, let me know how it worked for you.

hi
in my all-feeds page i'm seeing only 10 feeds. is there a way to show all of the feed updates preferably with a pager?
Excellent !
7 x Version doesn't show example
Maybe i'm missing something. Why not just make ninesixty a subtheme of zen and skip making a zen starter sub-theme?

> Why not just make ninesixty a subtheme of zen and skip making a zen starter sub-theme?
Zen-2.x itself declares very little CSS. Most CSS files are under the STARTERKIT.

This sounds like a great plan. If it could be made compatible with Zenophile, I can see my workflow speeding up dramatically.
<cite>Zenophile allows themers to very easily create Zen subthemes without all the tedious file copying and find-and-replacing required when creating subthemes by hand - http://drupal.org/project/zenophile</cite>
<dl><dt>Mollom</dt><dd>Thinks I am a robot</dd></dl>

> If it could be made compatible with Zenophile
It actually does - in the README.txt you can already find the drush commands that make it automatically.
> Thinks I am a robot Are you? :)
Result looks nice, but it seems to me that it's somehow too complicated (sub-sub-sub-theme?)
anyone tryed http://www.designinfluences.com/fluid960gs/ with zen-960?
Yeah, maybe If Zen would have allowed not creating a sub-theme in order to use it, it would have been simpler, but I doubt it will change.

Sorry for the dummy question but as far as understanding, what you describe here is the process behind and as for installing is as simple as describe in the instal.txt file in the zen_ninesixty file? Any where it's sounds grate! I am just descovering Zen, got used to Tendu...

> is as simple as describe in the instal.txt
Correct, most if it - but it makes sense, since I am the one who wrote the install.txt...
wow this is amazing,well this is why i love the CMS they have got plenty of features, useful plugins, seo friendly and easy to use. css menu

This is awesome as I was just setting up a site with the 960 theme and was thinking about merging it with Zen. Going to download it!
For some reason, Mollom didn't generate an image captcha when I first visited.

This is such a great resource that you are providing and you give it away for free. I love seeing websites that understand the value of providing a quality resource. It's the old saying "what goes around comes around routine". Long Distance Movers

It is actually possible, and quite easy, to do file uploads and associate them with imagefields using the file.save service, and attaching the resulting fid to your node's imagefield. You need to do it in that order but it is really simple.

Indeed, there's file.save, that uses base64_encode. Also the PHP docs mention: "Base64-encoded data takes about 33% more space than the original data." It seems that for bigger files cURL is a better and faster solution, and we don't need to bother we encoding.
But you are right, we should probably implement also Services.Upload - to save the login to cURL.

I've added this function to the API and will release a blog post once it's ready, this will remove the dependency for cURL when uploading files. cURL still give some additional options, like the ability to get the upload progress and better performance.

Greetings!
I was wondering if you or some one else could port this project to be used with vs2010? I am a newb to C# programming, and need this functionality for a project without having to reinvent the wheel :)

The porting should be straight forward, I don't think any change to the code is required, VS takes care of update the project files for you. If you get other errors, let me know.
Brice

Hi,
Thanks for the code.Does it support API key authenication at the moment?
Shah
Not at the moment, The API supports only session ID.
Below, a cite from point:2 Download and enable the required modules: drush dl cck views features filefield services What module is "dl"...??? :O
drush dl -- is the drush (http://drupal.org/project/drush) command line to download modules, it's not an actual module.

Dear Brice,
Would it be possible if you could explain how to "enable the required modules?" I am having trouble with step 2.
Thank you.
Just go the your module page and enable them manually.

Hi, Thank you for your source code. However I can only login in with your code. When I try to load a node, it always reurn the message "Node Get - Server returned a fault exception: [404] Could not find the node". Could you help me?
Hi, The current version of Services module does not provide node.save method, but node.create and node.update. Could you advise how to change the DrutNET code?

It's easy to say it's "actually possible, and quite easy, to do file uploads and associate them with imagefields using the file.save service..." but I have been looking and have not ever found an example of how to do this from .net with the cookcomputing dll. Heyrocker, I appreciate your work and expertise in this area, but to qualify as "quite easy" it would be nice to provide some c# or VB code references to show how this is done from .net. Please?
My initial try at using the DrutNet API on my website gave me a "invalid XML response" error. It would be nice to accomplish an xmlrpc services file upload without another dll, but the DruNetAPI looks promising. Thanks
Why would you think Heyrocker wrote this post?

Sorry if my post was misdirected, I was intending to comment on "File upload by heyrocker on 30-Apr-2010". Perhaps my frustration emanates from the dearth of accessible, coherent, or accurate documentation for Drupal Services, especially .net to Drupal via CookComputing.XmlRpc. Rob Lowe had an excellent video on "Drupal from the Desktop" (http://www.robloach.net/node/82) but it is now out of date and does not address CCK fields and file.upload, the blocking issues for my project. Thanks.
Good job Amitai. I'll try to pitch in if I can.
Wundebar!
Confusing!

Allow associating entities (e.g. node, users, etc'.) to other entities - In plain English it means that you can have posts related to a group. Not more, not less
Sorry-- but this sentence says two completely different things. Either it allows "associating entities" (meaning any entities) or it only relates posts (nodes?) to a group. They can't both be true. And what about users? Previously both users and nodes were associated with one or more groups.
could blocks be individually allowed to a group, a group of groups, or everybody please ?
If blocks were fieldable that would have been easier, but it won't be in D7. To show blocks only on certain groups, you will have to use your own custom logic or use the Context module.

> posts (nodes?) to a group
No, posts are not nodes. D7 is no longer node-centric, nor is Group. A user, is an entity, and it relates to the group the same way a node relates to a group.
This seems slick, smart and flexible. Looking forward to exploring it further!

OG is growing up as well. :) I love how this leverages groups as sandboxes. Are you combining your efforts with the Spaces team?
The only thing I'm kind of opposed to is the name. Why not use the semi-convention of plural? "Groups" would suit this beauty better than "Group", IMO. Especially since it will probably most often handle multiple groups.
Anyway, keep up the awesome work!

> Why not use the semi-convention of plural? "Groups"
Group is actually following Drupal's core convention (e.g. user module; node module).
OG module was wonderful,I like it, It's features were wonderful.the rewrite of OG,may not be user friendly!,Tannks.
You're right. Modules like Views, Spaces, etc, came closer to mind but they are more so breaking convention than setting it. I retract my comment and leave Group as just an awesome module. :)

What if I want private groups which *don't* allow post authors to mark individual posts as public?
I.e. don't show the "group content visibility" drop-down list on the "Add Node" page, and instead always use it's "use group defaults" value?

> always use it's "use group defaults" value?
You can set the default value for the field and disable/ hide it with hook_form_alter().

Is it also possible to relate global user roles to groups?
(There seems to be a Drupal5 og module here http://drupal.org/project/og_default_roles that does this, but nothing since then.)
Use cases would be: - give site editing/administration permissions based on group membership - use custom content types, with some private fields which should only be viewed/edited by members of certain groups (field permission can only be given on a per-role-basis)
This can already be done now days with the Rules module integration. Group will have integration with Rules2.
Thanks for your time and for your clear explanations in the video. OG is a nice and powerfull tool!
Wow that seems like it's going to be a really useful tool. Johnny from BuyDiamondRings.org
I have been looking for this kind of article since long when eventually i searched on google.com and find this. Thanks for such wonderful work. Web Design
I can confirm that it works well. I tried a couple of times and then finally got it. vuelos baratos
Its a little difficult but interesting. I like it.
Its a little difficult but interesting. I like it. Carbon Footprint Calculator
I think there is already the best module for groups in Drupal 7, I am very glad to hear you've just ugraded the Group, weldone and keep it up! Robin from Nottingham
בהתחלה חשבתי שמדובר באתר של מכונות תפירה עד שהתעמקתי באתר, למרות שזה לא מה שחיפשתי, אחלה אתר!

item.title: Code sample for DrutNet API - connect, load node, save node and upload file

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Brice, Thanks for the info on DrutNET. I have been using CookComputing.XmlRpcV2 with a VS2010 VB application for client-side xml-rpc interface to Drupal 6 Services 2.5 with partial success. I have been able to do simple user.login, node.put, and DrupalProxy.ViewGet but are two issues I have not been able to implement: File.Upload and CCKField.Save below the Title or Body level. I downloaded the DrutNet project because it looks promising for implementing these features. For starters, I thought I would simply try to reference DrutNET.dll for the additional methods, but I get the build error "Assembly 'E:\Downloads\DrutNet\DrutNet-master\Dlls\CookComputing.XmlRpcV2.dll' must be strong signed in order to be marked as a prerequisite". As I am already referencing CookComputing.XmlRpcV2 (v2.5) in my project, I was hoping not to replace the currently working version with a different version from github. Any suggestions for proceeding? Thanks.
PS: I am trying to create new nodes of a known type rather than getting a node and updating field values. Does this change the procedure? Thanks.

FYI: The build error "Assembly 'E:\Downloads\DrutNet\DrutNet-master\Dlls\CookComputing.XmlRpcV2.dll' must be strong signed in order to be marked as a prerequisite" goes away if I use the CookComputing DLL from your project rather than mine.
Still have the question about creating a new node rather than updating an existing node. Thanks.

Typo: In the final code snippet step #4, I assume the parameter passed to the DrutNET,Services constructor should be services_settings rather than service_settings?
After adding "services/xmlrpc" as the services endpoint to my base URL, login fails with the following exception: "Server returned a fault exception: [-32601] Server error. Requested method system.connect not specified."

item.title: Should Organic groups be renamed to Group?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Do you think "Groups" like Views, Panels, Feeds, Features, Rules,... ?
It is tempting, but contrib should imitate core as much as they can. In Drupal core that names are singular.
my vote is for Groups plural. When using OG the point is to have more than one group.

Agree, it's User and Node so it should stick to that. Totally think its a good name change...in the 7 branch and beyond. That way there aren't any conflicts with modules currently depending on (or looking for) OG
I also think Groups sounds much better than Group. Just as Feeds sounds much better than Feed. Sean Bannister

There's nothing organic about them. The only reason to keep the old name is because it's fun to make caveman jokes about "Og". :-)
Given how radical the changes are, I think that would make the upgrade easier, not harder, since it can just view the old OG tables as foreign data to be imported as a one-shot-deal rather than treating it as an "upgrade".
Saying "organic" is like saying "Form API". It just makes people's eyes glaze over and they back away slowly.
+1 for groups +10 for the communication and overall effort you've been putting in to this

"Groups" is unquestionably more confusing to refer to but easier to find/learn. It's very clear what you mean if you say "OG" whereas if you refer to a "group" the meaning is not so clear. Yet "Group" seems like the much more logical choice for a module whose purpose is to provide groups. So +1 for logic, -1 for clarity?
I have the same problem with the Feed and Views modules.

Groups is indeed much more understandable than OG, but this comes with a practical downside: it is currently much easier to find something OG-related with a search engine than it will be if we switch to Groups, which is a much more commonplace term on the web.

> it is currently much easier to find something OG-related with a search engine
The same issue will raise from the CCK => Field/ Ubercart => Commerce change

I suggest User Groups.
Using only the word Group is too abstract.
Since things can be placed in groups, adding who or what is being grouped in the module makes it clearer.
Nope - we have only two options OG Vs Group.
What Larry says.

Entities are singular. There is one entity you are working with; a node, a user, a group. Compare: node_save() group_save() vs. nodes_save() groups_save() The fact that you can have multiple groups and not just one does not mean that you need a Group API that knows how to handle a single group in the first place, before trying to handle multiple. Some of the plural-form project namespaces were caused by already registered/existing other projects. For example, see http://drupal.org/project/feature -- everyone bear in mind that projects can be re-owned and re-purposed, if there is a maintainer and community agreement.

Is a group an entity on Drupal 7? Nodes, users, and taxonomy terms, are examples of Drupal entities. But IMHO Groups, Views, Panels, Features are "tools". groups_group_save() groups_group_content_save()

All entities: a view, a panel, a feed.
Not sure what a tool is, but sounds like everything is a tool.

> Is a group an entity on Drupal 7?
Yes.
> groups_group_save()
It is group_save() -- like node_save().
> groups_group_content_save()
No need for such a thing. The group is "living" inside the field API -- see group.field.inc

FYI, Some discussion was split to this issue -- http://drupal.org/node/794312
I think maybe we should move this poll/ comments to a single place, maybe the front page of g.d.o -- so this will get a bigger exposure. Many people/ contrib will be influenced by this decision.

Then Drupal entity == stdClass object ?
D6 content types (node) => D7: entities (node, user, taxonomy + contrib "fieldables")

Let's move the discussion to http://groups.drupal.org/node/75988
I believe it will be visible to more people.

I tried voting a few days ago, and I tried again today, each time the poll was closed.
+1 for "Group". Much clearer, especially when considering new users (the "organic" part was always needlessly confusing).
Also, +1 for the new code, concept, communication, and your efforts. It is appreciated.

I'm not sure what Anonymous tried to ask. The math is obviously wrong.
A stdClass object has no defined schema/structure. Content types ain't entities.

In favor of those that don't follow the main discussion I tend to go with the 3rd option - to keep OG module name as is, but in the UI/ menu/ entity name call it group. The main reason is that not enough people have voted, and I'm "afraid" to do such a major change based on so little voices.
I will also suggest User Groups as this is more friendly than Group which looks more general and that might be a bit complicated. Web design

Ok, this is ultra cool mojo you're sharing with us. And a schnifty use of features to boot 8^)
One minor correction for the post though, in step 3 "Navigate to /story-test" it should be /story-list
Gizra, Drupal slathered in awesome.
-James
AWESOME share! thanks!
@James, Corrected the typo, thanks.
"Next we have our custom code, which is in the .module file" - where is this, not understood. What should be done in this step?

> which is in the .module file
It's in step one -- download the attached feature, there you will see story_list.module. You just need to enable it.

This doesn't help if I want to learn how to do it in another context... That is, if I manually made things written in steps 1 to 3 - according to MY business logic - I would like to know what should I do next - an abstracted step, not an example.
Thanks

> This doesn't help if I want to learn how to do it in another context...
It does - if you will open the .module file and read the comments, which tell you what needs to be replaced for your custom code.
Got you, thanks! I will try this.

Super rad!
Since you already require a custom module it might be a good idea to implement a views hook to call ctools_add_js('ajax-responder'); rather than to use the PHP module and thus avoid its security/maintainability/performance issues.

@dalin,
That is correct, however I wanted the tutorial to appeal to non-developers as-well, so I've used "acceptable" quick-n-dirty ways to achieve this.

Don't have it working yet, but this should be doable without the monster that is Panels, right? I user a Skinr-enabled theme, and I'm planning to have a block view and a page view, with the page view taking the place of the node panel. Just need use the page view path and css class as needed, instead of the panel instructions.
Like I said, not working yet, but I don't expect to have any issues :)

Oy. Heads up if you're using Fusion to make this happen with Views only (no Panels): http://drupal.org/node/804674
The issue involves the views page template missing the code to print custom css classes. Caused me a bit of grief...

> doable without the monster that is Panels, right?
I doubt if the performance will be much different between the two options - you should test and compare it.
Also, your solution is not exportable, which for me is sub-optimal.
> taking the place of the node panel
This is not a node panel. This is a panel page :)

First of all - thank you for this. I was searching for this for a while. Using this method how would you go about adding a class of "active" or such to the list elements of the view in the first column? I'd like to differentiate the menu list item that we are currently on from the rest by grabbing the node id from the 2nd column. But I'm not sure how to do that exactly. Any help?

I never knew of the "contributed module ideas" g.d.o group so I never even knew of the poll. I would have voted to completely change the name but can live with just the UI changing. Does changing the UI also mean changing the URLs that have typically been hard-coded into og?
As a side note... it may be worth creating a g.d.o group for the purpose of the groups module. A place to discuss possible add-on modules, etc. I'm a heavy user of og so I'm interested in its future. :-)

> Does changing the UI also mean changing the URLs that have typically been hard-coded into og?
Yes. Anyway the URL should change as it needs to include the entity-type as well (e.g. group/node/1/admin)
> it may be worth creating a g.d.o group for the purpose of the groups module
Sounds good.

I know of a poll on this site, but not on g.d.o.
Odd. There has been a broad consensus on the poll here, so I really don't understand the need for another one?

"Suddenly two phones rung, It was Dries (the founder of Drupal) and Matt Mullenweg (the founder of wordpress) on the line.... He started with the rdfa said the first, his cms is usable said the other... "Geek Gashashim" material... Good job man Lior

Watched the video and enjoyed the presentation.
I'm just starting to learn Drupal due to my work wishing to convert a world wide taxonomic website. In your presentation, you mentioned not seeing a reason why a User should be a group. Well, that is the basis of our website when it comes to permissions. A scientist/professor joins and has their own group based on their user name. They can then invite others to their group (typically grad/undergrads submitting/editng work for them).
I wonder if Organic Groups will work for our situation though. We have various content types (specimen, image, location, etc) being submitted by users/groups that can be public or private. I believe you said in your presentation that a person needs to be part of the group in order to see that group's content. Is it possible to enable groups to submit public vs private content? Where other users not in the group see the content?
As well, in making a user a group type, I see those fields on the user's settings page. They can change their type so they are not a group. I could not find any place to disable them from changing it. Any suggestions?
Sorry if this is the wrong place to post questions. If it's wrong, I'm more than happy to post in a forum or something if you point the way.
Thanks for the presentation.. it did help me along some.
That was really awesome presentation and personally I think it was the best I have seen in Copenhagen. Great work guys!
Loved it... who knew the solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict lay in Organic Groups. Ha ha.... Great speech. Good work.
Nice post i added it to my bookmarks Bridesmaid Dresses
Really a fantastic presentation! OG Rocks! Your hindi is really good. :P
It could't be any better!!! Using art (act) to present developing scenarios.... more than perfect!!!!
The link to the video is broken
coolest presentation eever!
Awesome presentation. Love it. Great work guys!
Although I haven't delved into the code, I like the simplicity of this module. I have one question, however... what have you done to set it apart from "activity" and "heartbeat"?

> what have you done to set it apart from "activity" and "heartbeat"?
You should look at Message's home page,where it describes the differences. Basically, it's exportable (using CTools), translatable (using i18n), and it used Views instead of trying to implement it's own display interface.

thank you for this module , i will be studying it and see how it works here is how i did corners with css : File name: cornered_theme.tar.gz
File size:88.43 KB

it seems to work on all browser , and it is very simple to use : why is javascript method preferred over the css method ?
i forgot to mention that it is a sub-theme of pushbutton
got mine into github as well : https://github.com/yakoub/drupal

@yakoub The rounded corners module is less-hardcoded than your theme implementation.
1) If you use rounded corners in Firefox/ Chrome it knows not to use an image, and uses the browser's rounding-corners capabilities. 2) In your module you can't change the width of the rounded corners (or at least not easily, you'll have to change the images). 3) Using a jQuery selector you can round the corners of elements without the need to "catch" their content in form_alter() and pass it via a theme() function. You can do it through your template.php/ hook_init().
Any chance Amitai you will port it to D7?
A combination of border-radius, border-image and box-shadow will give you wonderful results. It's 2010, start using CSS3.
וואו תודה רבה.. סרטון מעולה, עזר לי המון..
תודה סרטון מדהיםם!
This bug report says it all: http://drupal.org/node/1007542 It's a pity that it OG can't be installed justl like that.
Seems D7 is very good for development. the OG d7 file size is cut off 3X.

> Seems D7 is very good for development
Indeed, the mix of Entity + Fields is making a lot of the heavy lifting.

This looks great. I must remember to try it next time I have a large site migration to do from db to db. What about custom XML to a Drupal db? Have you tried the new Drupal 7 feature for migrating from XML? I find this a far more common requirement - wondering how well it works. My current method is to write some custom code for this, but I've done it so many times now I can almost re-use my work...

Hi, Thank you, this is very useful. But I'm having problem with establishing node reference relations. Can't find any example or documentation. Can you help me with it. Waiting eagerly for the next chapter!

I wanted to use a custom code also , I decided to use this module to try , my conclusion is that by custom code its harder and longer. by the way you can also migrate from XML to Drupal using this module, you can see an example in the migrate_example module.
i will upload part 2 before the weekend

Sorry for being such a noob, but I've done my best to setup the .info, .inc and .module files and enable them in the manage Modules, but to no avail I receive the "unrecognized migration" for some reason. To see how you assembled the code above would be very helpful. Thanks.
This is very useful. Thank for giving it in detail. But problem is i'm not so expert in php. Is there any plug-in ar something to make the task easy?

thanks. i am currently testing the patches of the FieldCollection moudule (http://drupal.org/node/1175082) and had some problems but you post helped me. i had no unique ID in the SqlMap :)
cheers marco
Another great post, I appreciate all the work you put into this site, helping out others with your fun and creative works. Lipozene

I was wondering if you had any ideas about setting the value of the MigrateFileFieldHandler path argument based on values retrieved from the legacy node table. (My file path changes based on values stored in the database...so the value looks something like this: /path/to/file/$month/$year/$filename.) I am at a loss in how to pass these variables to the handler arguments. (I thought I might be able to do this via prepareRow, but these values seem to be ignored by the handler. I suspect the arguments have to be set before the file mapping is created(?). Any help is appreciated.)

Thank you so much for this Migrate Extras tutorial! The sample Migrate code of beer.inc and wine.inc excellent, but it's currently harder than it should be to find more detailed documentation
I used your "prepare" function example here: http://drupal.org/node/1118132#comment-4312094.

Hi
I have csv file I want to choose between two modules node import or Migrate What is the benefit to use Migrate? Thank You

so very helpful
any chance of getting a copy of the module so i can see how it pieces together

Additional tutorial thank you very much, helped me a lot, not only the sample migration code is excellent, and has a very detailed document, I think this is useful for many people，please do keep up this great work.
thanks guys - good stuff. We need lots more tutorials on the internals of Ctools!
What Roland said.

Just discovered this blog! Very useful. Question: If you defined 2 node contexts in the panel page, how would you access the two in the plugin? I tried adding two "new ctools_context_required(t('Node'), 'node')," but they both came back with the first context of the page.
Superb work on the D7 version of OG. I've been playing with it for a while, and it's very nice. Keep up the good work :)

Did you think about basing OG on the relation module (http://drupal.org/project/relation)? I know, it wasn't ready at all when you started OG7. But by now, it seems in a good state and actually does pretty much the same as you do in OG (just replace "membership entity" with "relation entity" and you're done, more or less).

> Did you think about basing OG on the relation module
Yes, I have had a look on this module. As you mention it wasn't ready when OG7 was out, nor when I've started the 7-.x-1.1 branch. We'll see...

I've been an og user for a long time and have loved the functionality it provides. I've been excited about og.d7 ever since watching your UN presentation (hysterical and informative). I'm still learning about entities in D7 and had a question about how OG.D7 is written. From what I understand node is just a type of entity. I see that you're using an entity of type node to create your group instead of a starting off by creating an entity of type group. I'm curious about this design... mainly because I'm still trying to learn D7 entities. I hope that all made sense. :-)
Looking forward to talking to you about this in London!

I would argue though that using a core module rather than a non-core one is a bit bigger advantage than 'minor'. Anyway, what ever works...
Amir

Ever since D7 was released I was curious to the extent that the overlay module could be used. I started to have ideas that it could replace other contribs but never had the time or client need to research it. It's great to see that it can be done and that it was successful.
all you need to activate the overlay is just one simple hook_admin_paths

Hi dude, Please help me with install. I download and install 'subforms', 'entity' what needed to work 'user modal'. I install and enabled modules, but there is nothing work. I use 'fancy login' to open login form in popup window. But i need form like in 'user modal' where login and register will be in one form and in popup. With 'fancy login' it doesn't work, and i switch off module 'fancy login' to test will it work with standart 'login form' but thats too not work. Help me please dude. What i've doing wrong? Or there i must add some code to the link?
Sorry for my english ( Answer me pls. I'll be wait!
Did you follow the README.txt ?

Yep. I follow all points.
1) i install module and required modules, and enabled this modules. 2) give permissions for anonymous to overlay 3) i dont need quick registr, and i skip that point.
And how that must work? In blocks i placed 'user login' block to in some block, but there only form. And i wrote into browser url path http://mysite.com/user/login but nots work, opens page with standart forms to login. If not hard, can you explain me in pictures or in video?
Sorry, but im new start with drupal.
Or i must follow points in 'DEVELOPER TIPS'?

Hello, thanks a lot for your module, and especially the example for the user modal. I have read the user_modal_example.module file, and it is very clear. However, I would like to embed the user modal form with a specific content type => how can I do that starting from your example (starting line 153 I guess) ?
Can you tell me what that music is during the fashion show? I really like it! :)
It's a remix of prodigy -- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5G2JV_1RQoE
I would prefer something more chill out, kinda lounge rather than Prodigy to be honest Magento Developer.

Man, your presentations are just great. I couldn't help laughing out loud when you said "FAQ". Respect!
(Also, the animation effect at the contact form at the bottom of the page rocks.)
Thanks Mr. Falk! :)

You're a rockstar, my friend. Great work and effort. This simplification makes the concept much easier to understand, and removes a WTF (the separate group entity) that hit me the first time I was looking at OG7.
Happy to see you found help and funding so fast. And the changes are really interesting. I say +1 amitaibu !

> You're a rockstar, my friend. Great work and effort.
Thank you! :)

That sounds just great, I'm sure it's becoming much simpler to use that way! Thanks a lot for the write-up and all your work! ++
Also great to see you found funding!

One thing I would love to see are permissions sets, not just one universal default. If I have 100 groups and 50 all have one set of permissions and the remaining 50 all have another set of permissions then no matter what I'm sol if one of those group sets needs a permission changed. If instead those groups were assigned to permission sets it would only be a matter of seconds to make the changes.

> see are permissions sets, not just one universal default.
In the new branch you will have per bundle permissions. If you want to have permissions sets, you can actually already do it by implementing hook_og_user_access_alter(). See og_ui_og_user_access_alter() for an example. You will have to provide your own UI, though.
I'm not sold on the Other Field idea. I mean, we are using two fields to store ONE piece of information. I'd rather work on a slightly more complex widget than using two fields for it.

> I'd rather work on a slightly more complex widget than using two fields for it
I agree it can make sense to have this kind of widget, however I think it's more than "slightly more complex". Patches are welcome of course :)
Awsome article. Thanks for sharing knowledge. Give me much to solute my problem. best regards

@Capi Etheriel I think the "Other" Field is a good idea: in my specific case a user can belong to only and only one group, and I allow posts only in the group the user belongs to. So in this case I don't need the "other groups" field and simply I removed it from the list of fields attached to my entity.

What happend to me this afternoon, that I was trying to use a module which extends EntityReference, but relies on having the field data in field_data. Obviously this add-on module does not work with OG's specific EntityReference fields :/
Took me some time to debug.. such things are downsides of this specific use of EntityReference Fields I would say.
Greets!

Happy 2012 amitaibu - thank you for sharing this recipe with the world. Before diving in to try this approach - can you clarify if this offers OG members to the option for controlling their 'notifications' eg either opting out or suspending them, as per the old og-notifications approach
Has anyone successfully integrated messages and messages notify as how groups.drupal.org does in D6?
Cosyst Devices is a leading manufacturer and installer of Industrial Air Curtains for Doors,PVC Strip Curtains, Tip and Tell, Insect Killer and more. Contact us now!

item.title: Sending LOTS of emails (Hint: with Drush)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I don't see how this is any different than using cron. Why not just fire your drush command with your crond instead of Jenkins? A lot less resource usage that way...

> I don't see how this is any different than using cron.
Cron is executed once an hour, and it has many tasks to deal with, not only with the digest task. By creating this Drush command, and invoking it more frequently (e.g. every two minutes), I'm able to process more digest emails than I was able to do with cron -- and prevent cron hanging and timeouts.
I mean, you could just add a line to your crontab that invokes your drush command every two minutes.

Oh, I see what you mean. What I like about working with Jenkins is that it keeps a console log of the "builds", but I agree crontab is a good solution as-well -- thanks for pointing this out. As long as "something" is invoking my Drush command and making sure my emails are sent properly I'm happy :)
Otherwise great post :)
10x. Fixed the link.

If your doing a lot of things over the network, a good option is to do it in parallel. That's where http://drupal.org/project/httprl comes into play. http://drupal.org/project/smtpua uses it to send out emails "instantly" instead of on cron. Just another way to do it.
@mikeytown2 , thanks for those links, I can think of other use cases for those (e.g. sending email notifications, upon comment submission).

That's interesting idea. I've already seen project “Relation edit widget” which uses Subform for creation entities. Unfortunately I can't run your module.
Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in commerce_product_product_form() (line 28 of /vhosts/kickstart.home/profiles/commerce_kickstart/modules/commerce/modules/product/includes/commerce_product.forms.inc). Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in commerce_product_product_form() (line 37 of /vhosts/kickstart.home/profiles/commerce_kickstart/modules/commerce/modules/product/includes/commerce_product.forms.inc). EntityMalformedException: Missing bundle property on entity of type commerce_product. in entity_extract_ids() (line 7409 of /vhosts/kickstart.home/includes/common.inc).
Drupal 7.10, Commerce 7.x-1.1 | 7.x-1.2 Maybe this is my problem and I'm sorry for that :)
You should try it on a clean installation...
Solved on clear Drupal, thanks!

I get the same error. Looking through module code I see it's working only with default product node and commerce_product entity definded by commerce module. I have custom commerce_product entity and I'm trying to adapt this to my needs. The problem is that debugging this error shows me that commerce_product_product_form function gets $product argument as an array of products instead of the single product which it expects. My commerce_product reference field is multivalue field so I wander is this ready for 1 item limited product reference fields only ?

> I wander is this ready for 1 item limited product reference fields only
Yes, the above *example* module deals only with 1:1 relationship between a product node and a commerce product. You can rely on this example, and extend it to our own needs.

Would't it be beter if the module would be listed under "Commerce (contrib)" on the modules page?
Nice Module by the way! Thanks for sharing

i have some problem, when i create field text and set Number of values unlimited.
Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in commerce_product_product_form() (line 28 of C:\xampp\htdocs\drupal7\sites\all\modules\commerce\modules\product\includes\commerce_product.forms.inc). Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in commerce_product_product_form() (line 37 of C:\xampp\htdocs\drupal7\sites\all\modules\commerce\modules\product\includes\commerce_product.forms.inc). i install drupal clean

Same here. This functionality is really useful but, like the other comments, I have the same error. I guess I have the right structures. Debugging the code I can see the product is not being created, that's the reason why those errors appear. The node is created but the product entity is not. If I find a solution I will post it here.
groove
Great tutorial buy how and where do I change the CSS to position the widget?

item.title: About strong partnership and winning a game of bowling

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: w00t! Bring on the bowling, and pray I don't lap you this time (or something - I don't know how to toss around bowling insults).
Even though I read this right after finishing our morning scrum with Gizra, I had no idea where it was going. Paragraphs 1-4 "Yes. Yes! Heck Yes! Exactly!!!". Paragraph 5: "woooooooow =)"

Thanks! I was indeed afraid lots of people will not bother reading it all. But well, I prefer a good story than a boring one... With that said, I'd be happy if you could tweet about it, so it gets a bigger impact :)
This makes me think Gizra and Commerce Guys are wonderful places to work at, and best of all, an excellent place to make friends.

item.title: What is Message module, and its new features

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: i am using it and have also worked on that og-message integration. good module, hopefully Sanjay will expand functionality so that i can be up to date with my drupal sites at all times :)

Nice post, but hey - thats the World Wide Web. A blogpost nearly without links (Kickstart/Commons/Message module itself) is somewhat annoying. Unfortunately this is true for other posts from this blog. :(
Good thing, your comment corrected that problem.

> A blogpost nearly without links
Thanks, I've added a link to Message module. I know it's debatable., but I actually don't like blog posts with too many links, IMO it just distracts from the topic.

Nice module. I am thinking to use this module into my website.
Thanks to share this.
Looks interesting
Is it possible to use Message like a Facebook timeline, like Heartbeat does? And to use it with Organic Groups? And work with something like Flag Friend?
How can Integrate sending message with sms please help me i'm in hurry

I supoose you can try with any SMS platform that accepts emails. I use (not with drupal) www.infosms.es but its spanish and you maybe need another solution (twilio, etc maybe support this feature) Good luck!
Great presentation! You should to add it to the OG page on d.o. Thanks!

Just using your "Organic Groups" module and I like it. Very nice presentation!!!! Congratulations.
Rafa Terrero (@rterrero) from Spain.
Great post! Is it possible for anonymous users to subscribe to contents?

Hi,
you mentioned the following in your post:
For a scalable solution, we are currently working - with a great help from fubhy - on implementing some sort of DrupalQueue to be able to process lots of Messages
Is that done or not yet?

> Is that done or not yet?
Yes, it's done. Message-subscribe can use Drupal core's Queue API to register the message, and later on, you will need to process it. When time permits I'll blog post about the "you will need to process it" part (e.g. waiting-queue module).

Content types?
Is there any built-in logic to include subscribing to content in the subscription management interface? My use case would be for the above functionality as comment subscription, but to also offer the ability to subscribe to new content.
I can pass the node through with a message_subscribe_process_message() call on hook_node_insert(), but I'm not sure what to flag---as far as I can see, one can't flag a content type. Flagging every node would give them a huge list of nodes which isn't too helpful for subscribing/unsubscribing to a content type.
Would perhaps tie a nice bow on the ecosystem if I write a module message_subscribe_content that integrates with this same interface and provides a place to specify paths that people can link to as they see fit; /subscribe/blog or whatever.
Or maybe views... but presumably there it would need a cron task to poll for new matching content.
Great walkthrough and helpful, as I'll be doing a test deployment to Heroku soon as well. Thanks for the tips. You're my hero. Ku.
Great article! Every Drupal developer have to read it. Thanks!
